Bockel acutely remarks that it may have been the purpose of Clodius to force Cicero to propose the grant of extraordinary powers, in order to compromise him in the eyes of the aristocracy and the ponti ces. He certainly succeeded in putting him in a dilemma: to oppose the bill would have been to brave the wrath of the people and the en· mity oi Pompey, who had labored to secure his recall from exile; to favor the measure was to antago nize the aristocracyae quod...
